intro: Odontocarpa dentata, commonly known as the toothed mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its fibrous stems and hairy foliage. Odontocarpa dentata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
